1.q_string: 'VA' is the unit of which one?

A 220 V, 100 W bulb is connected to a 110 V source. Calculate the power consumed by the bulb.
If two bulbs, one of 200 W and the other of 100 W are connected in series with a 100 V battery, then which bulb will have more brightness:
q_option: 100 W bulb will have more brightness
200 W bulb will have more brightness

q_option: Fall of potential per unit length of the wire

q_option: The voltage is different in both resistor.
The current is same in both resistor.

  1. The shorter length of the potentiometer wire is preferred.
  2. Copper wire is used in potentiometers.
  3. The electric field inside the potentiometer is variable.
  4. If the length of the wire is halved, the position of zero deflection in a potentiometer occurs at a longer length.

Which of the following statement is incorrect?

q_option: Depends on quantities other than quantities provided.

q_option: Electric field produced by a point charge
Electric potential due to a point charge
Electric field due to an electric dipole

1.q_string: An electron is placed in an electric field of intensity \(10^{4}\) Newton per Coulomb. The electric force working on the electron is:

An iron ball is having radius \(0.04\) m. A charge of \(1.6 \times 10^{-7}\) C is uniformly distributed over its surface. What is the electric field at a point \(0.2\) m from the centre of it?

Diagram shows three capacitors with capacitance and breakdown voltage mentioned. What should be maximum value of the external emf of source such that no capacitor breaks down?

The inductance of a coil is \(\mathrm{L}=10 \mathrm{H}\) and resistance \(\mathrm{R}=5 \Omega\). If applied voltage of battery is \(10 \mathrm{~V}\) and it switches off in 1 millisecond, find induced electromotive force of inductor.

A wire of resistance \(12 \mathrm{ohm} /\) meter is bent to form a complete circle of radius \(10 \mathrm{~cm}\). The resistance between its two diametrically opposite points, \(A\) and \(B\) as shown in the figure is?
